metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8217 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ff_hevc_parse_sps function in libavcodec/hevc_ps.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.2 does not validate the Chroma Format Indicator, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted High Efficiency Video Coding (HEVC) data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
